item.title: Speeding traffic, 4th July
item.description:
Traffic coming along Crayford Way in both directions to Thames Road are speeding. This is a 20MPH area and as a driver they are easier doing in excess of 40 MPH. The local school kids catch their bus along this stripe of road .... it is an accident waiting to happen. We either need a speed camera, speed alert board, clearer signage...... Please can the council come and view this area of the road that is particular busy morning rush hour and from 1pm until the evening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This street is full of holes and subsidence., 4th July
item.description:
Nearly fell off my bike the other day. I notice some areas seem to be marked for fixing but there are many more. I think whole street needs to be relaid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walcot Square, Kennington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deadfox found in our garden. Body has been bagged and placed in our garden waste disposal bin in front of property, 4th July
item.description:
Dead fox body. Body is bagged and places inside the garden waste disposal bin in front of our property (135-Hillcrest Road, BR14SA)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillcrest Road, Sundridge, London

item.title: Large load fly tipped at Peckarmans Wood entrance next to Sydenham Nature Reserve., 4th July
item.description:
Mixed - builders waste, old furniture & fittings, delivery boxes. Occurred between 10.30 and 11.30 today, 4th July 2025. Photos attached show name and address of recipient for following up to establish and prosecute the fly tipper.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckarmans Wood, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti still here, 4th July
item.description:
You are ignoring all the reports of graffiti, response times have nose dived. As a result the neighbourhood is getting worse, businesses are being affected and people feel uncomfortable walking around here. We are proud of where we live and we all pay our taxes we should be able to rely on Lewisham’s services to do your bit to keep the streets and walls clean.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swallow Close, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rope Climbing frame damaged, 4th July
item.description:
The rope Climbing frame needs urgent attention, one of the bolts at the top of the rope frame has come away and all the other bolts are loose, the ones at the bottom are all screwed in tight, This is very dangerous and if gives way could cause an accident to children. please inspect urgently,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refusing to stop parking and blocking drive way, 4th July
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodberry Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Large pile of dangerous rubbish on street, 4th July
item.description:
For a week there has been extensive rubble on the road outside of 22 Nutbrook st. Not only does it occupy 3 parking spots, there is a lot of dangerous material at children’s height. Very worried for my children as they walk/ scoot along the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Nutbrook Street, London
